website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy tripod that offers 360-degree ball head movement. An excellent choice for experienced photographers who need a tripod with a little more weight for stability.
pros: Heavy build holds up to 15 pounds
At 5 pounds, it's still lightweight enough for travel
cons: A few owners have had trouble with the locking mechanism on the legs

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Initially I liked this tripod, however the build / quality of it has been really poor. It has not survived 90-days of light use. First the locking mechanism on one leg failed almost crashing my d500. Then a month later the riser for the head failed and won't lock. Horrible quality. Do not buy. Save your money and get a different tripod. Stuck with an expensive paperweight now.
customer_reviews.author: jolleyx

customer_reviews.title: Camera slides when taking vertical pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera a couple months ago and I just recently tried a vertical shoot. The lens is a 24-70 and is a little heave but not too bad. The camera rolls down and cannot stay fixed. I tried to contact Amazon, but after an hour of chatting, they figure they cannot help and asked me to call the manufacturer. They send me a link that directed me to a Financial institution, not the product itself. So, I am stuck with this defective product and a terrible service by Amazon. Not sure if I want to recommend this product to anyone thanks to the service I got.
customer_reviews.author: davosamba

customer_reviews.title: Leg stop broke on first real use.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted and expected for this to be my last tripod purchase for at least a decade. Unfortunately, I haven't had time since I bought it to use it more than testing it. The first time I took it out to take some nature photographs, the stop on one of the legs snapped and the tripod tipped over. Fortunately I was able to catch it and no damage was done to my camera or lens. But now I can't lock the legs for the tallest use. It looks like the stops are made of plastic; very poor decision for one of the most fundamental pieces of a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Moses Milazzo

customer_reviews.title: Metal that locks the legs strips
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of use, the metal to lock the legs in place stripped and now have a tripod with only one leg functioning properly. This tripods worked great out in the field and holds stable even on windy days. Be gentle when opening the legs or the metal ridges that locks the legs in place will strip.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbad

customer_reviews.title: Game Changing Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Tripod. I love it in every way, Worth every penny! I couldnt ask for more, and in the 2 months I have been using it I havent found something I couldnt do it with. This tripod is VERY sturdy, can go as high as a need, and lower than I would ever need with its adjustable center column. Great for just about any photography you can think of. The ball head however isnt as great for filming but everything else it will do the job nicely. If you want a full video review you can check out my review on YouTube at dTech Media - Game Changing $200 dollar Tripod.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Doc

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last longer than this review.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most versatile tripods I've ever used. There are so many configurations and uses for this tripod that I can get almost any shot that I'm looking for. Unfortunately, the center column tensioner broke after writing this review, now the center column can not be adjusted in any of the positions as originally designed.
customer_reviews.author: JPM.Cuisine

customer_reviews.title: Very good tripod if you don't want to be buying a replacement any time soon.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-built and versatile tripod. I did a lot of research (too much, probably!) and ended up going with this after reading a particular blog post from someone who seemed to know their stuff. I am not sorry. It can do everything you want it to do. It is not lightweight, but it is not needlessly heavy. It feels like the weight it needs to be to be sturdy and stable. The controls for making adjustments on it are pretty easy to get the hang of, and it came packaged very nicely. I would choose it again.
customer_reviews.author: rsilverstTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: The inner plastic piece that always the arm to slide up/down and tighten came off repeatedly. Now it no longer tightens. Prior to that, if you could tighten it, you can to try really hard for it not to move, which in turn easily bend the metal. I shoot product photography and this thing hardly made it a year. Tryin looking elsewhere for the price.
customer_reviews.author: N.N

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, professional.. all my photog friends are jealous!
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit confusing to set up because it's such a high quality tripod with so many ways to use it. Had a professional photographer friend over to help me figure it out and he was pretty in awe of it so I guess I made a great purchase. I ordered it specifically so I could video coloring book reviews so it has a arm that will come out over the table so you can video straight down hands free.. I ordered a iPhone holder adapter to goes with it and a remote so I'm all set now. VERY sturdy and comes with a nice carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Coloring Book AddictTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Overall well made design. Easy to use, easy to adjust. I use a large frame DSLR with a decent weighted lens, this does a good job. Unfortunately it does wobble a little but does settle down once left alone for a second or two. Read the size prior to purchase. This is larger than I thought. When added to a loaded camera bag it weighs it down a bit. Overall very happy with it, but this will not be my travel tripod for hikes. I would buy again even with the few issues simply due to the price. Really is a great deal for someone looking for a good tripod for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: T. deLaGrange

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to adjust, can be put in darn near any configuration you can imagine, not very heavy yet still with terrific stability. All the levers are smooth and the pan/tilt is very smooth. Easy to get camera on and off and most adjustments can be done with one hand. Very well-built and ideally suited for my uses. The carrying case is very rugged as well - and you can carry it over your back or if your camera bag allows - strap it to that. I think the price is excellent for the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: kestrelco

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tripod so far. I took it out on a photoshoot and it performed incredibly well. The quick adjust grip is superb and gives you a lot of control. I shot at all angles and it kept the camera steady. The build quality is great. I was shooting outdoors on a very windy day and I wasn't worried about my camera falling over. Update: After 8 months I'm still loving this thing. It is cumbersome to travel with but you just deal with it because when you get to where you are going, it will perform admirably. You will love the quick adjust pistol grip!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Avanti

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod......But........
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod. But the pistol grip and the quick release can not be tightened enough to hold a DSLR and lens without slowly slipping, drooping and loosening. The pistol grip gets in the way of the camera's battery grip making it so the camera can't be mounted property to the pistol grip. As it is not light nor small it is not for travel, hiking, or back packing. This is more for studio or easy access areas. As a tripod it is strong and steady, but the grip it to be desired. Buy it without a mount then get a different mount.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tripod if you aren't traveling....
customer_reviews.text: This is really an incredible Tripod. However, I have started traveling every year twice a year to a different State and to a different Country. This Tripod is huge, very heavy, and doesn't collapse into a smaller size for luggage and to go hiking. I needed to return it for a travel size Tripod at my local Photography store I took classes at. Too bad, but you have to pick and choose what is more practical for your use. Really loved this Tripod otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: SouthFloridaGirl

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of the same model of this tripod I have ordered. All the online reviews seemed to pump this tripod up so I thought it would be a good buy. The first tripod I received the foam grip on one of the legs was ripped down the side and within a week of use the legs stopped staying open when telescoped. Sent that one back and got number two. This one was working well for about two weeks but now the mechanism that allows you to select how far you want the leg to open has stopped working on one of the three legs. This tripod is a piece of junk. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ~ no camera shake
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this tripod. When I opened the box all I kept saying was "wow". Compared to my other inexpensive tripod this is fantastic. Taking it on a cross country trip my husband & I are planning towards the end of the summer I've used it a few times for moon shots using my 150-500mm lens and I love the way there is no camera shake at all. This photo was taken with my 150-500mm lens at ISO800, F/5 and 1/2 second shutter speed from my front porch. Fairly easy to figure out. Still going through what it can do. I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jahn

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty sturdy and I love that you can pull it ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tripod for almost 6 years. It's gone to the beach, mountains, everyday use and gone through different DSLR cameras. It is pretty sturdy and I love that you can pull it out and use it as a bird's eye view. I have noticed that after this many years there are minor issues such as the locking pieces on legs get a little stuck (probably because of fine sand) and I had to replace the quick release part that attaches to the camera because it broke. Other than that, I still use it and it still works after 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Phanessa

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is very stable and the ball head keeps my D7500 with 70-300 zoom very stable. Tightening the rotation lock does seem to make it rotate a bit, but as long as I am careful, I can work around this. I especially like the lever locks on the legs instead of twist which is one of the main reasons I bought it. It is a bit heavy, but I knew that going in and was willing to trade that off for stability and reasonable price. I already have a light-weight travel tripod but I wanted this to be very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Young

customer_reviews.title: Quick release mount loose and can’t be tightened
customer_reviews.text: After owning this tripod for less than a year, the quick release mount became loose from the ball head. There is a bolt at the top of this part, but it seems that they glue the threads on this bolt, which has prevented me from tightening it. Consequently, it doesn’t matter how sturdy the tripod is, it still won’t hold my camera in position properly. There is always still movement after everything is tightened, making it very hard to properly compose a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tripod
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tripod for a year. It is sturdy but not that light weight. I like the flip releases on the legs, the pan head and the center column tilt system. I have done some hiking with it and while it isn't ultra lightweight carrying it around isn't awful. I have used it a lot over the past year and the only sign of wear is the one of the plastic pieces comes out when I flip the center column around. It goes right back in so nothing is perfect but this tripod has been very good.
customer_reviews.author: C. G. M.

customer_reviews.title: Ball head does not accept cameras with L brackets
customer_reviews.text: I don't consider this to be a "pro" model, because the ball head doesn't accept cameras with L brackets. The tripod appeared to be well made. Vanguard's only option is to either buy a different head, at extra cost, or pay another $100 for a tripod with a head that accepts an L bracket. If I was looking to pay $100 more, I would expand my options to other makers. I think Vanguard is making a mistake by pairing this ball head with this tripod. I returned the tripod, and will continue looking for better options.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Riley

customer_reviews.title: great lightweight tripod
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I love this. It holds steady in many different angles, and is mostly very sturdy. The legs move easily and hold their position, and the feet which can be flat or pointy have been very useful, but can get a muddy buildup if you are not quick to clean them. Which means, um, clean your equipment. It is a little awkward sometimes attaching the camera, but gets easier over time. Overall, great light tripod. I would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Williams

customer_reviews.title: Know what you are buying!
customer_reviews.text: I have read the reviews about this tripod not being sturdy enough with long heavy lenses! I have been a professional photographer for 35 years and bought this tripod because i was tired of luging around my Bogen 3057 Beast that would expand to 7' tall and support a small toddler with no problem...after all the tripod originally held a Mamiya RB67! This tripod is great for most shoots...It is extremely lightweight and i found it to be very stabile holding my Nikons with a variety of lenses up to a 180 2.8 Lens. You will not be sorry if you buy this tripod for the right reasons and purpose!
customer_reviews.author: John St.Hilaire

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy as can be
customer_reviews.text: After trying cheaper tripods over the years, I spent the money on this unit. One of the best products i have ever used. This unit is so sturdy I no longer worry about my camera being on it. I now am into macro photography and absolutely love it. Spend the money for this unit and you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT light - but for what it is you wouldn't want it to be. This is an outstanding tripod. There's very little it won't do. It's larger than I expected - but that was my own fault for not reading carefully. I will love using this tripod when I have time to set it up and use it properly. Really great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Radcliff

customer_reviews.title: Best tripod I have ever had!
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is very flexible and provides a steady platform for my still photography even with my 6 pound camera lens. The ability to tilt the center column is a great aid in macro photography. It is a little heavy, but it is worth it for the added stability. The provided ball head works very well. Vanguard provides two quick change adapter plates which is very handy for swapping cameras.
customer_reviews.author: cimages2/Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend it this is the nicest tripod I've picked up. Everything works well super versatile. Got some great shots of Neowise and Jupiter so far but I recommend you play with it alot before you take it out cuz it can do alot. Quality so far is awesome and it does come with a pretty sturdy camera mount.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but it broke. Customer service was great resolving it
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be a design defect with the leg locking mechanism which causes the teeth to sheer off relatively easily. The Leg stop locking into place, but I contacted vanguard and they shipped me the parts needed to fix it. They also would have taken the whole unit back and repaired it, but I opted to have them ship parts to save on shipping. So, if buying new, I'd say just baby it a little when engaging/disengaging the leg locks, and trust that Vanguard will do right if it does break.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: it's pretty well made
customer_reviews.text: I have a while to play with this Tripod with my Canon 5D Mark IV. It took the load of my 6lb lens, so in terms of quality and sturdiness, it's pretty well made. The one I received had a problem with one of its legs where even after locking in place, it would still slide in/out with a bit of force, I had to tighten the screw myself. Seems like a QA oversight to me. My main gripe with this is that when using heavier setup, its a bit harder to move precisely, due to to the weight and that you have to twist the handles to loosen it before you can move.
customer_reviews.author: JC. Panderp

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tripod, look no further. Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is amazing. It is the first tripod I've purchased so it's definitely better than the free hand-me-downs I had been 'using' previously. It is absolutely worth $150.00. I didn't realize how easy tripods can be to use... maybe it is just because they nailed it on the design of this one. I can so quickly adjust the height, pitch, yaw and roll... If you are considering this one and it is near your budget limit buy it. It is worth it and I can't imagine finding anything better for less. I wouldn't be surprised if the price of this one goes up.
customer_reviews.author: skysoph

customer_reviews.title: Best tripod especially for Food Photographers and video
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is AMAZING. I am a food photographer and I take videos for youtube, and I had been looking for a tripod that was high quality and more versatile, and this is everything. It is the best quality tripod I have had, and it is so flexible. You can take overhead pics, tons of different angles, even upside down if you want. I use a weight on the back when I do overhead, but I don't think it's really that necessary because the tripod is really steady and doesn't seem like it would let my camera fall. But, I have a super expensive camera so I do it just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My 1 day initial review - very good value. Quality is great, it's much heavier than I expected, but it's a good thing. Head exceeded my expectations as well, it is perfect in both quality and usability. The only thing is that I wish leg locks were metal, but the plastic they used is quite strong. That is my only concern going few years forward. If something goes wrong, I will update this review, but so far I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: How to remove the ball head
customer_reviews.text: It took me two thousand years to remove the ball head, so I’ll write this in case it helps someone else: There are three small screws and one central large screw connecting the ball head to the monopod. Use the included screw driver tool to remove the small screws. Then unscrew the ball head as you normally would.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Fn Vicious

customer_reviews.title: I like the tripod a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I like the tripod a lot. I'm no expert on tripods, this is only the second one I have ever owned. Thirty-five years ago I bought a $40 Vivitar tripod, the Vanguard 263 AB replaces it. The difference is astounding, it is twice the weight, immeasurably sturdier and so easy to use. It was shipped promptly, well packaged and delivered in only two days using Amazon Prime. My only regret is having waited so many years to invest in a quality tripod. If ever I need a sturdier tripod, which I doubt, I will purchase a more expensive Vanguard; for my use, landscapes and real estate, I really don't see this happening.
customer_reviews.author: papatch

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Tough as nails and steady as a rock. I love this tripod. It's equally as good as any $1000 top of the line tripod as far as smoothness, sturdiness, and quality are concerned. It's a tad heavy but I knew what I was getting so it's not a complaint. The weight helps tremendously in high winds. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: the ball head is wonderful, and it comes with a carrying case and ...
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I'd want it to and then some. It seems well built so far, the ball head is wonderful, and it comes with a carrying case and two mounting plates for the head. This tripod will easily extend to my eye level (I'm 6'3") while remaining rock solid stable. I wish I had bought this when I started out instead of the chintzy tripod I started out with. Edit: note that the plates are not compatible with the common Arca Swiss standards. This hasn't been an issue, unless you buy a mounting accessory that requires such compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: K Mc

customer_reviews.title: Broken and useless after only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this tripod, and I've been using it for 3 months and I've been really happy with it, but the other day two of the tripod legs are essentially "stripped," meaning they dont lock. There are three notches for different angles of the tripod legs to lock into place, but now two of the legs dont lock into any of those positions, they just swing all the way out. This was a great tripod but now its pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: xo

customer_reviews.title: Great all around tripod.
customer_reviews.text: Stop messing around with cheap, flimsy tripods and get a good one - like this. It's not too heavy but it is stable. How stable? Stable enough to produce great results with a 500mm (750 equivalent) lens on a Sony a6000. It easily adjusts to about any position one could desire. The ball head is smooth and easy to work with. The included carrying bag is, wonder of wonder, appears to be durable and the unit fits easily in it. It cost a bit more than I wanted to pay, but you do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: emv

customer_reviews.title: Locking mechanism on legs failed with very light usage
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most standard locking mechanisms for the legs when you are opening the tripod (I'm not referring to leg extension) these have an adjustable expansion where you press a button and it allows you to widen the stance of the tripod to give you more stability. The locking mechanism failed and now the let just keeps opening until the tripod falls over. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD & CANDICE SHAPIRO

customer_reviews.title: heavy but solid
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't quite ready for the bulkiness of this tripod or the weight! Still getting use to it. I can't imagine myself taking this on any hikes or long walks unfortunately. However, with the added weight comes added stability. The quality is definitely there and no complaints in that department. I love the pistol grip and the ball rotation which makes for quick transitioning from portrait to horizontal which is what I was looking for. I also like the clips on the legs vs. twist locks like on other tripods, much easier on your hands, especially in cold weather!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Huteson

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional-quality tripod for all but the longest lenses. The head is smooth and easily manipulated. The camera mounts using a small, plastic adapter which is sure to get lost somewhere. Probably too heavy for hikers, though. Excellent platform for slower shutter speeds.
customer_reviews.author: SpyderRyder

customer_reviews.title: Great Advanced Tripod
customer_reviews.text: While I will be using this tripod primarily for real-estate and event photography, I could easily carry it along with the rest of my gear or in my large pack if I needed it for professional scenic photos on a return hike if the subject warrants use of a tripod. This is one of the best tripods I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Russell A. Ligeikis

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before buying this. For the price and all the features, I'm glad I went with this tripod. Feels very well built and high quality, if a bit on the heavy side. Not an issue for me as I just throw it in the truck with the rest of my gear. Very stable, and great ball-head included. I would definitely buy again if need be, but my guess is it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I ordered this initially as a travel tripod without watching a youtube review to get a idea of the actual size(It's a full sized tripod) of it. Once I saw the packaging I knew I wasn't going to be able to take it to Iceland with me, But I decided to open it anyway. And I am glad I did! this thing is awesome. EVERY ANGLE IS COVERED!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and sturdy stand. Have travelled internationally with it internationally through waterfalls, cities, hanging off cliffs, in fields, off buildings, etc and the versatility for Photo and Film is awesome. The price is great and the quality is even better. If there was a sixth star, I would give it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastics used as parts
customer_reviews.text: Used this product only once. Was in storage for years. Took it out last week and used the middle arm horizontally to mount camera . Realized the plastic ring through which the middle arm/ leg passes is so cheap that it broke when I pulled the arm out. Payed so much for such a cheap product. Can’t believe.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Good tripod. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this tripod professionally for Real Estate and product photography for over a year now with larger mirrorless cameras and I love it! I really like the ability to tilt the center post. The only problem I've had with it is that eventually, the head (SBH-100) developed some play that could not be tightened down. But with the lifetime warranty, I just sent the head back to Vanguard and the sent me back a refurbished replacement (took about 2 weeks). Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed User

customer_reviews.title: Best budget friendly tripod for serious hobbiest photagraphers!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this tripod! OK, so it's not an expensive Manfrotto, but for the photgrapher on a budget, like myself, it is definitely a "home run" and worth every penny I paid for it. Speaking of which, mine was "used but like new." It was in perfect condition. Not a scratch, dent or blemish to be found on it. It performs flawlessly. To say I am happy with my purchase is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Adams

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means an expert but this is a big upgrade from my 1990's era vcr tripod. The pictogram instructions are almost useless, but I was finally able to figure all the adjustments out. Seems like an overall good value.
customer_reviews.author: gunnnut

customer_reviews.title: Highly pleased with this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Used for a year now. Can speak to durability now, and it is built like a tank. I have dropped, carried in hand, and strapped to backpacking pack with no issues. Very sturdy and easy to adjust. Level aids in panoramas, ball head is smooth and stays where positioned. Ability to adjust tripod so camera can shoot down is a near feature and more useful than I expected. A highly capable tripod that does many things well. A little large, but comes with fantastic carry bag and straps to a pack tolerably well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: camera fell off when tripod pivoted. BAD. I gave this as a gift and recipient used once. BAD. Now that I have been made aware of poor quality, I would like to return for refund or credit as this item was not inexpensive. NO GOOD
customer_reviews.author: Shelley s.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Love my Vanguard tripod. My first Vanguard disappeared and when I replaced it I took it up a notch to the Pro 263AGH. (There are two 263's). It's certainly not a backcountry tripod due to weight but I so appreciate a tripod that holds the position and doesn't waver in the Montana wind. I will never have a tripod without a pistol grip. Adjustments are so easy, especially if you have arthritic hands or are wearing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: klabaty

customer_reviews.title: Leg lock not working on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I’m waiting on a replacement to arrive, my first unit had a problem out of the box. One of the leg locks wouldn’t catch after being extended, and the tripod won’t stand correctly. Hoping the replacement works better. I’ll update my review once I’ve had a chance to use the replacement. -- Update - The leg lock has broken on my replacement unit as well. I've had it a while now, but I rarely use it, so it's not like I'm wearing it out. I'll never buy another Vanguard tripod.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good tripod with great flexibility
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this tripod to shoot overhead videos. When shooting overhead it's difficult to get the camera completely level and adding the camera makes it tilt down a bit. Overall it's a good tripod with great flexibility, it's just not as easy as I thought it would be for my use since I need it to be completely level.
customer_reviews.author: T J

customer_reviews.title: Priced well just wish had more
customer_reviews.text: I like it and its held up for some time now just wish it did more even it cost more. No carbon fiber problems like other have on other brands. Its light weight holds up well, all around really worth the price. Again just wish had better options as its limited at times, if you like the way it holds the camera and adjusts then cant go wrong, but if you want it to adjust more or go down more cant given its limitations
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money, no question in my mind. Did a lot of research.
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Vanguard. This is everything I need in a tripod. Has put up with 20k miles and lots of in and outs. Trails, beaches, marshes and fields. I'd like to get my hands on the trigger head. I mainly shoot landscape, specifically astrophotography. That calls for a tripod that won't move. None of the knobs or nuts have come loose, the head stays in place with a full frame DSLR and heavy ol' wide lenses attached. 300mm is longest I've had on here. The only con - not having a better way to tighten the plate to the camera. That's the only thing I'd change about this tripod. Besides the LED lights I glued to the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Mangan

customer_reviews.title: This is the last tripod you will buy.
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is ABSOLUTELY worth the cost. It is by far the best tripod I have ever used, and it supports (without creep, even at extreme angles) my Canon 60D with Sigma 100-600, which is a beast! I cannot praise this tripod enough- the versatility and quality of this tripod is unrivaled!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: and I do like the features that can make it go all the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and I do like the features that can make it go all the way down to the ground. I have to say that I really do like it and feel like it's a great tripod, the reason I give it a low review is that as soon as I took it out of the box the foam on one of the legs was already split. Pretty pissed that I spent so much money on this and the quality can be so poor. I didn't even get to use it before it was already showing wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gongage

customer_reviews.title: so far no issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert and have never had a tripod before but this thing is rock solid, a bit on the heavy side but then I do like it a bit heavy as I'm using from 17 floors up facing a river so it is quite windy and it works awesome
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod and Wonderful Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod, very sturdy. IF I had to come up with one con it would be grip took a little more effort than my old-lady-hands prefer. Still I really like this and use it for family group pics with my self timer. Wonderful fast set up and take down but so far holding up very well, great value for the money. I very much recommend this tripod. Wonderful general use tripod that is sturdy and easy to use. Love the carry case and covered legs for cold outdoor work.
customer_reviews.author: Workin' Mom

customer_reviews.title: A very solid tripod
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take eclipse photos this summer and it's perfect. Very stable, large enough that I can fully extend it and not stoop to look into the camera. It's heavier than my old tripod and I wouldn't try backpacking with this one, but it is very solid with lots of great features.
customer_reviews.author: Mongo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and quality
customer_reviews.text: i bought the Vanguard Pro 2+ and was so unhappy i returned. i was skeptical about Vanguard products but bought this tripod based on the many excellent reviews. so far i'm very happy. smooth, easy to operate, knobs firm but not too tight, stable, and the extension arm is easy to operate. i suggest you give this tripod a try.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester_cat

customer_reviews.title: Nice tripod but got damage the same day I got it or came in damage.
customer_reviews.text: I order this tripod and within the same day I got the tripod, one of the legs got damage or maybe I came in damage and I didn't notice. One of the legs wouldn't lock in position at the base. It just kept spreading/opening. Thanks to Amazon/Vanguard I was able to returned and decided to get the Vanguard Alta Pro 2+ 263AP. The locking mechanism for the leg at the base in the new tripod is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Tony TekInsights

customer_reviews.title: Decent but one of the legs not clicking into place
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tripod over manfrotto to save some money. It is a decent tripod and I have enjoyed it but after about a few months of use one of the legs is not clicking into place and sometimes when placed on hardwood floors slides ever so slowly. This is frustrating because I take bracketed photos and can't have any movement. I tried to go back to my Amazon order for this item to contact the seller but that window closed in November sometime... Pretty disappointed and not sure it's anything I can do with tools to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Albus

customer_reviews.title: Good construction, has held up well
customer_reviews.text: Good construction, has held up well. Though I am not a professional photographer, I originally had a cheap tripod and was having to use the timer to take pictures so they would come out clear(my hands are not very steady). Since I got this, I can actually take pictures that are not blurred, without the timer. The central column when extended is not exactly rock solid, but is still very good. At first I thought the price was kind of high, but after using it, I think it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod. Has many excellent features and feels very sturdy. Easy to operate and none of the locks feel loose. It grips well to the floors and has retractable carpet spikes which is good. This tripod can get pretty much any angle with some very extreme possibilities and feels very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tripod
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the tripod once but found it steady, easy to use and easy to reposition. For the money I cannot imagine anything better. Will likely buy additional heads for panning when shooting. Used with a cannon slr, mid-range zoom, and flash to shoot my daughters wedding.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Love this tripod
customer_reviews.text: This baby replaced my beloved Mefoto Tripod. I got this so I could use it for overhead videos in addition for night photography. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: this is the tripod i have been looking for. tried a couple of lighter ones..they just don't grip the weight of my big boy lens and camera body. this unit is rock solid, easy to adjust, and holds on to my canon 100-400 lens like anything
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Tuckerman

customer_reviews.title: Mounting screw broke!
customer_reviews.text: The bolt that screws into the camera snapped! Thank goodness I had the strap on still. The tripod is great just not happy with the mount. So gotta buy another one. Would not but again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiernan Gene Creamer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: A Little heavy but a well made Tripod, Good Value.. look forward to getting years of service from it. Do wish the storage bag had a zipper instead of drawstring closure. Directions easy to follow and the flexibility to position your camera makes this a HOME RUN TRIPOD, Would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Best Tripod Ever
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is way too good. The tripod bag is a bit rough on the shoulder without a pad. A lot of people have complained about its weight, but for me, I found that the complaints are not true. I am not some puny photographer, mind you. I lift, bro. The foam cushions around the legs are a nice addition and when you read the manual and learn each component and how its used, you will find that reaching angles and heights are extremely easy. The pistol grip can be a little tight, depending on how much you tighten it. I would 100% recommend this product to ANY photographer that loves creating good photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Tomu-san

customer_reviews.title: For spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility of the stand, not many angles it can't hit(that's why I got this 1) definitely meet its standard. A little costly and bulky to take to and from.the range every time but quality products come at a cost
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value for the money. ROCK SOLID, reliable, and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this tripod for a couple of years. I've used it on the beach, in the salty Atlantic ocean, in mountain streams, and even Iceland! It is ROCK solid and has yet to fail me once. People want carbon, not sure i'd use a carbon tripod over this one even if it was given to me. This weighs less, and costs less, than a lot of the carbon "leaders". Why pay $800+ for a carbon tripod that weighs 2lbs+ more than this tripod? This tripod meets my landscape and travel photography needs nicely.
customer_reviews.author: M. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I researched before buying and decided to go with this. It has been very great. I have a manfrotto that was double the price of this one, but I use this one more than it. It is very sturdy and built well. Great Tripod!
customer_reviews.author: DFrazier

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks, it seems to be strong and solid. The ball head is smooth and easily adjustable. It is taller than I expected, at 5'8" I don't even have to extend the center column with my T3i on top. Nice carrying case. Three section legs lock solidly. I could not be happier. Pros: Big, heavy, solid. A great economy, quality tripod for beginning to intermediate photographers. I think a lot of pros would be happy with this too. Cons: Big and heavy, not for backpacking a long ways
customer_reviews.author: J. johnson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, poor value
customer_reviews.text: Almost all users, after a year, experience leg lock issues, whereby one or more of the legs fails to lock. Tightening of the allen wrench screw does not help, dispite what some suggest. Stay away from this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: LoriMom

customer_reviews.title: Item broke on arrival - boo
customer_reviews.text: I was excited but disappointed when I discovered the head was damaged when removing the item out of the box. Not sure if this is a coincidence, but another user who posted feedback on this item also uploaded an image of this tripod head with an almost identical break. Hope I didn't receive his damaged item cause there is sticky glue on the silver areas as shown in the image. Worse, hope this is not a production defect. As much as I want to like this product, it's challenging to switch my perspective on a damaged item.
customer_reviews.author: SeaTea

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: In January I purchased this. I kept having problems since the week getting it but then had a medical issue so couldn't address it. I now look and what the problem is the plastic piece where the wingnuts tightens the mount into place was broken already is appears upon purchase because it never held the piece in place. How can I go about getting this replacement plastic piece???
customer_reviews.author: Norah R

customer_reviews.title: Legs are flimsy and bound to break
customer_reviews.text: The tripod legs did not last on this thing. They where very flimsy, and then now one of the legs will not lock back into place. This tripod didn’t last me 9 months. I love the head on it I took it off of the legs and mounted it on one of my older bogen tripod legs.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: The tilt head can be a bit sticky if you are use to being able to pan with an even drag but from just a fixed position it seems
customer_reviews.text: Although this tripod seems a bit light weight in construction, so far I have had no issues. The tilt head can be a bit sticky if you are use to being able to pan with an even drag but from just a fixed position it seems to work fine. There is a slight bit of play when tightening either the tilt head or the horizontal pan so it does take a little patience to get your subject placed in frame. This is obviously not a top of the line tripod but it works for me as well as its price point.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Great, nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy piece of kit. It has taken me a while to get used to the ball-head, but that is me and no fault of the tripod. I just received the 'rebate' of a free pan/tilt head, but I cannot see how to get the ball-head off. I sent the company an email, but have yet to hear back. I haven't used any of the fancy pivoting legs or anything yet. I used it for shooting video in church, and this is the only time I have extended the central column. I had the camera up above head height, and it was plenty stable. This *was* indoors, though, and there was no wind to contend with.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Buglass

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great.
customer_reviews.text: I have found the last tripod I think I'll ever need. I've bought cheap 25 dollar tripods before. Then I bought a small Manfrotto. Then I bought this. The pistol grip is great, the tripod has tons of flexible options for angling it for macro work and other things. It feels solid (not quite as solid as a heavy-duty wildlife tripod, but you shouldn't even be looking at tripods at this price point if you want that). I use my tripod rarely, but when I do, it needs to be able to measure up to the options that I need. This does. My rig consists of a Canon 7D with a 24-105mm lens. It holds it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Jurina III

customer_reviews.title: BEST TRIPOD OUT THERE!
customer_reviews.text: Best Tripod EVER! It is heavy duty, stable and firm, and can reach just about any angle. Great for overhead table top photography. Nice product compared to many others which don't even come close to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Roze2013

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Not to sure on the value based on the cost but I love this tripod. I take a lot of photos with my Nikon 7500 in this is by far the most stable and versatile tripod I have ever owned. Absolutely no wobble .
customer_reviews.author: Keith Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Stands Out in a Large Field
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully made, light, agile and stabile tripod. Perfectly suited for a fast moving shoot environment. I have taken this in the field for wildlife shots and onto the street for news shots.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod
customer_reviews.text: The Alta Pro tripod is extremely versatile and easy to use. It can be set up very low for macro nature photography, as well as on uneven surfaces. Built-in level bubbles ensure images are straight. The ball head further allows adjustments for virtually any angle. The only downside is that the tripod is a bit on the heavy side, so it may not be something you want to lug around everywhere every day. Still, it's a great product for a reasonable price, so it's highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Wollet II

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this tripod for almost three years and it’s held up great in many challenging scenarios. I recently returned from a backpacking trip where it was put through numerous ordeals and it held up great. I’ve had stable 30+ second exposures for hours long sessions, even in the extreme low to the ground placement on a muddy lake edge. Combined with the hammock and some rocks, it’s also worked despite strong 30-40 mph winds. I’d love if it were a bit lighter, but that is the only criticism I can muster.
customer_reviews.author: M. Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love every feature on this tripod. Very solid construction. The hand grip is very convenient. No more twisting and turning knobs. The price is reasonable too. The only downside is the weight. I personally think that "a lightweight sturdy tripod" is an oxymoron. Sturdiness always comes at a cost. All in all, it's a reasonably priced heavy duty professional tripod that will last long. For travel or family pictures, perhaps you should look for something lighter.
customer_reviews.author: YW

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Tripods Around
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Very Solid / Stable - Adjusts to any position that I can think of - Easy to adjust - Pistol grip is quick to change / modify the position Cons - You sometimes have to think through using the pistol grip if you need full side-to-side and up-and-down panning if the tripod is in certain configurations (It is a bit of a stretch, but I'm trying to find something to help)
customer_reviews.author: Too-Much-Research-Before-Buying

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sick. So many bells and whistles. The 5 degree increments on the head are very cool for making really good 360 degree panoramas. Everything is adjustable, feels sturdy and is none too heavy. The ONLY problem I have is there's one axis the head doesn't seem to have accounted for, which you will find annoying when trying to compose some shots. There is a work-around which is difficult to describe but it can be manipulated. It just should have been thought of.. Minus 1 stars for that big oversight, if not for that, a full 5.
customer_reviews.author: redsand209

customer_reviews.title: Super deal!
customer_reviews.text: The head is strong enough to hold my 150-600 lens with no creeping and yet easy enough to quickly move to track drag boats moving at 250 mph in a quarter mile without missing a shot. The tripod itself is light yet durable. As soon as I pulled it out all of my photography friends were asking where to get this exact set up. Don't forget to buy extra quick releases for all of your big lenses - you'll love it that much!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: Every time I see anyone else's tripod, I love mine even more. This thing has levels in so many places! I used this at night recently and only just realized that it was great for taking shots directly up as well. It has a spot for it to stay perfectly in place looking directly up, which helped a lot for the very long shutter time pictures I was taking.
customer_reviews.author: Poring

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tripod! Mine actually broke after a year of use (the plastic where the legs angle out cracked and made the tripod unsturdy). But Vanguard fixed it free of charge! I did have to pay for shipping to get it to them but thats a lot cheaper than a new tripod and is a win in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Kriddle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, sturdy tripod with all the features I wanted. My cousin bought a top of the line one that I was jealous of but could not afford. It has worked flawlessly, has all the features of my cousin's tripod and it cost less than what he spent on his ball head. The weight is an issue when out hiking, but it's not enough of an issue to lower the review to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: horrible product!
customer_reviews.text: This tripod has been nothing but a headache since day one but I have to use it everyday so haven't been able to return it. It wobbles, doesn't hold it's settings and the grips have moved and torn. I have to use photoshop daily to correct the unstability. Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: jkmp

customer_reviews.title: THE BEAST !
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT QUALITY. WELL BUILT. EASY TO USE BUT MAKE SURE YOU UNDERSTAND THE CAMERA LOCK SO YOUR CAMERA DOESN'T FALL OFF IT. THE STAND DOES HAVE SOME SHAKE TO IT WHEN ELEVATED SO YOU WILL NEED A SHUTTER RELEASE CABLE OR REMOTE IF MAKING A SLOW SHUTTER SPEED PICTURE. NOT A PROBLEM THOUGH ON MOST SHOTS, THE PISTOL GRIP IS A SNAP TO USE & LOCKS UP SOLID. I'M REALLY VERY HAPPY WITH IT. FOR THE PRICE I DON'T THINK IT CAN BE BEAT. EVERYTHING WORKS JUST GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: I've never used such a high-quality tripod. The difference ...
customer_reviews.text: I've never used such a high-quality tripod. The difference between this tripod and a $40 tripod is night-and-day. The fluid pano is so smooth and much stronger than the plastic contraptions I am used to.
customer_reviews.author: furry monsters

customer_reviews.title: The last tripod I'll ever need!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for low light and night photos. It is remarkably stable. If you have a windy day use the rock bag or tie a bag to the center loop. The build quality is amazing and has no signs of wear after almost a year of use. The dual purpose feet are fantastic for beaches or broken ground. The head and arm assembly adjusts six ways from Sunday so it will work for just about any angle.
customer_reviews.author: CPUDoc

customer_reviews.title: Great seller and tripod
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service from this seller. I received the item a day earlier then expected.It was sent by FedEx which I prefer as our post office is terrible here. The tripod is AWESOME! It is very sturdy and has a lot of different ways to set it up. Highly recommend this seller and tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Vanguard Alta Pro 263AB 100 Aluminum Tripod with SBH-100 Ball Head for Sony, Nikon, Canon DSLR Cameras, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Alta Pro 263AB 100 tripod kitAlta Pro tripods have unmatched flexibility, stability and enabling more angle possibilities than ever before. Its innovative Multi-Angle Central Column (MACC) System allows users to move the central column from zero to 180-degree angles in variable vertical and horizontal positions making macro-photography and special wide-angle shots a breeze.The Instant Swivel Stop-n-Lock (ISSL) System securely repositions the central column in one simple movement, in just a few seconds, while maintaining the tripod’s stability. Additional tripod features include advanced camera vibration and shock control, aluminum alloy legs that adjust to 25, 50 and 80-degree angles, quick-flip leg locks, patented premium magnesium die-cast canopy, hexagon-shaped central column for extra stability, and non-slip, spiked rubber feet for changing terrains and a removable hook for hanging camera accessories. Its SBH-100 fluid-like ball head rotates 360 degrees and has smooth locking knobs, an outstanding loading capacity and fine-tuning functions.
feature_bullets: 26mm 3 section aluminum alloy legs adjust to 25, 50, and 80-degree angles to enable extreme low angle photography. Quick flip leg locks and rubber feet with retractable spikes
Smooth fluid-like SBH-100 ball head rotates 360 degrees and includes quick release plate QS-39 and bubble levels
The MACC (multi-angle central column) system allows you to move the central column from 0 to 180 degrees in various vertical and horizontal positions
The Instant Swivel Stop-n-Lock (ISSL) system securely repositions the central column in one simple movement. Premium magnesium die-cast canopy, removable accessory hook, and anti-shock ring
Specifications: Folded height: 28.2", Extended height: 68.2", Weight: 5.4 pounds. Max. load capacity: 15.4 pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,050 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
